text: Resolution 2282 (2016)
Adopted by the Security Council at its 7680th meeting, on
27 April 2016
The Security Council,
Guided by the purposes and principles of the Charter of the United Nations,
textWithHighlights: Guided by the purposes and principles of the Charter of the United Nations,

text: Reaffirming its resolutions 1645 (2005), 1646 (2005) and 1947 (2010), and recalling its resolutions 2171 (2014), 1325 (2000) and its subsequent resolutions, and 2250 (2015) and the Statements of the President of the Security Council S/PRST/2001/5, S/PRST/2011/4, S/PRST/2012/29 and S/PRST/2015/2, and recalling General Assembly Resolutions A/69/313, A/70/6 and A/70/1,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming* its resolutions 1645 (2005), 1646 (2005) and 1947 (2010), and *recalling* its resolutions 2171 (2014), 1325 (2000) and its subsequent resolutions, and 2250 (2015) and the Statements of the President of the {{Security Council}} S/PRST/2001/5, S/PRST/2011/4, S/PRST/2012/29 and S/PRST/2015/2, and *recalling* {{General Assembly}} Resolutions A/69/313, A/70/6 and A/70/1,
uncertainties: The text references the President of the Security Council; this role is not listed as a separate entity, so it is mapped to the Security Council as a mentioned entity.

text: Taking note of the report of the High-Level Independent Panel on Peace Operations (A/70/95-S/2015/446) and the report of the Secretary-General on the Implementation of the Recommendations of the High-Level Independent Panel on Peace Operations of 17 June 2015 (A/70/357-S/2015/682) and the report of the Secretary-General of 17 September 2015 (S/2015/716) submitting the results of the Global Study on the implementation of resolution 1325 (2000), and encouraging coherence, synergies, and complementarities in taking them forward,

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity_normalized: High-Level Independent Panel on Peace Operations
mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: High-Level Independent Panel on Peace Operations

textWithHighlights: *Taking note* of the report of the {{High-Level Independent Panel on Peace Operations}} (A/70/95-S/2015/446) and the report of the {{Secretary-General}} on the Implementation of the Recommendations of the {{High-Level Independent Panel on Peace Operations}} of 17 June 2015 (A/70/357-S/2015/682) and the report of the {{Secretary-General}} of 17 September 2015 (S/2015/716) submitting the results of the Global Study on the implementation of resolution 1325 (2000), and *encouraging* coherence, synergies, and complementarities in taking them forward,
uncertainties: "encouraging" appears in a preambular, participial clause without an assignee; classified as a directive verb but with no assignees/deliverables since it is not an operative request.

text: Recognizing that development, peace and security, and human rights are interlinked and mutually reinforcing,
textWithHighlights: *Recognizing* that development, peace and security, and human rights are interlinked and mutually reinforcing,

text: Reaffirming its primary responsibility for the maintenance of international peace and security, in accordance with the Charter of the United Nations,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming* its primary responsibility for the maintenance of international peace and security, in accordance with the Charter of the United Nations,

text: Deeply concerned by the high human cost and suffering caused by armed conflicts, and recognizing the significant number of simultaneous security and humanitarian crises that the world currently faces, and the strain that this places on the resources of the United Nations’ system,
textWithHighlights: *Deeply concerned* by the high human cost and suffering caused by armed conflicts, and *recognizing* the significant number of simultaneous security and humanitarian crises that the world currently faces, and the strain that this places on the resources of the {{United Nations’ system}},

text: Recalling the determination of the peoples of the United Nations to save succeeding generations from the scourge of war, further recalling the determination to establish a just and lasting peace all over the world in accordance with the purposes and principles of the Charter of the United Nations,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling* the determination of the peoples of the {{United Nations}} to save succeeding generations from the scourge of war, *further recalling* the determination to establish a just and lasting peace all over the world in accordance with the purposes and principles of the Charter of the {{United Nations}},

text: Recognizing that ‘sustaining peace’, as drawn from the Advisory Group of Experts report, should be broadly understood as a goal and a process to build a common vision of a society, ensuring that the needs of all segments of the population are taken into account, which encompasses activities aimed at preventing the outbreak, escalation, continuation and recurrence of conflict, addressing root causes, assisting parties to conflict to end hostilities, ensuring national reconciliation, and moving towards recovery, reconstruction and development, and emphasizing that sustaining peace is a shared task and responsibility that needs to be fulfilled by the government and all other national stakeholders, and should flow through all three pillars of the United Nations’ engagement at all stages of conflict, and in all its dimensions, and needs sustained international attention and assistance,
textWithHighlights: Recognizing that ‘sustaining peace’, as drawn from the {{Advisory Group of Experts}} report, should be broadly understood as a goal and a process to build a common vision of a society, ensuring that the needs of all segments of the population are taken into account, which encompasses activities aimed at preventing the outbreak, escalation, continuation and recurrence of conflict, addressing root causes, assisting parties to conflict to end hostilities, ensuring national reconciliation, and moving towards recovery, reconstruction and development, and emphasizing that sustaining peace is a shared task and responsibility that needs to be fulfilled by the government and all other national stakeholders, and should flow through all three pillars of the {{United Nations}}’ engagement at all stages of conflict, and in all its dimensions, and needs sustained international attention and assistance,
uncertainties: Preambular paragraph with observing/reinforcing verbs; no operative verbs, assignees, or concrete deliverables. 'Advisory Group of Experts' is not in the entity list; classified under 'other'.

text: Reaffirming the primary responsibility of national governments and authorities in identifying, driving and directing priorities, strategies and activities for sustaining peace, and in this regard, emphasizing that inclusivity is key to advancing national peacebuilding processes and objectives in order to ensure that the needs of all segments of society are taken into account,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming* the primary responsibility of {{national governments and authorities}} in identifying, driving and directing priorities, strategies and activities for sustaining peace, and in this regard, *emphasizing* that inclusivity is key to advancing national peacebuilding processes and objectives in order to ensure that the needs of all segments of society are taken into account,

text: Stressing that civil society can play an important role in advancing efforts to sustain peace,
textWithHighlights: *Stressing* that {{civil society}} can play an important role in advancing efforts to sustain peace,

text: Recalling General Assembly resolution A/70/1, entitled “Transforming our world: the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development”, which adopted a comprehensive, far-reaching and people-centred set of universal and transformative Sustainable Development Goals and targets,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling* {{General Assembly}} resolution A/70/1, entitled “Transforming our world: the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development”, which adopted a comprehensive, far-reaching and people-centred set of universal and transformative Sustainable Development Goals and targets,

text: Emphasizing the importance of a comprehensive approach to sustaining peace, particularly through the prevention of conflict and addressing its root causes, strengthening the rule of law at the international and national levels, and promoting sustained and sustainable economic growth, poverty eradication, social development, sustainable development, national reconciliation and unity including through inclusive dialogue and mediation, access to justice and transitional justice, accountability, good governance, democracy, accountable institutions, gender equality and respect for, and protection of, human rights and fundamental freedoms,
textWithHighlights: *Emphasizing* the importance of a comprehensive approach to sustaining peace, particularly through the prevention of conflict and addressing its root causes, strengthening the rule of law at the international and national levels, and promoting sustained and sustainable economic growth, poverty eradication, social development, sustainable development, national reconciliation and unity including through inclusive dialogue and mediation, access to justice and transitional justice, accountability, good governance, democracy, accountable institutions, gender equality and respect for, and protection of, human rights and fundamental freedoms,

text: Recognizing that peacebuilding is an inherently political process aimed at preventing the outbreak, escalation, recurrence or continuation of conflict, and further recognizing that peacebuilding encompasses a wide range of political, developmental, and human rights programmes and mechanisms,
textWithHighlights: *Recognizing* that peacebuilding is an inherently political process aimed at preventing the outbreak, escalation, recurrence or continuation of conflict, and *further recognizing* that peacebuilding encompasses a wide range of political, developmental, and human rights programmes and mechanisms,

text: Recognizing that an integrated and coherent approach among relevant political, security and developmental actors, within and outside of the United Nations system, consistent with their respective mandates, and the Charter of the United Nations, is critical to sustaining peace, and essential for improving respect for human rights, advancing gender equality, empowering women and youth, strengthening the rule of law, eradicating poverty, building institutions, and advancing economic development in conflict-affected countries,
textWithHighlights: *Recognizing* that an integrated and coherent approach among relevant political, security and developmental actors, within and outside of the {{United Nations system}}, consistent with their respective mandates, and the Charter of the United Nations, is critical to sustaining peace, and essential for improving respect for human rights, advancing gender equality, empowering women and youth, strengthening the rule of law, eradicating poverty, building institutions, and advancing economic development in conflict-affected countries,

text: Welcoming the work of the Peacebuilding Commission as a dedicated intergovernmental advisory body to bring a strategic approach and coherence to international peacebuilding efforts, and recognizing the valuable work done in all its configurations and meetings,
textWithHighlights: *Welcoming* the work of the {{Peacebuilding Commission}} as a dedicated intergovernmental advisory body to bring a strategic approach and coherence to international peacebuilding efforts, and *recognizing* the valuable work done in all its configurations and meetings,
uncertainties: The Peacebuilding Commission is not explicitly listed in the provided entity list; it is normalized here to 'Other (Other United Nations Bodies)' under UN Organs.

text: Recognizing the need for United Nations peacebuilding efforts to have adequate, predictable and sustained financing in order to effectively assist countries to sustain peace and prevent the outbreak, escalation, continuation and recurrence of conflict,
textWithHighlights: *Recognizing* the need for {{United Nations}} peacebuilding efforts to have adequate, predictable and sustained financing in order to effectively assist countries to sustain peace and prevent the outbreak, escalation, continuation and recurrence of conflict,
uncertainties: "United Nations" could refer to the broader UN System rather than only the UN Secretariat; mapped to "UN" per available entity list.

text: Welcoming the valuable work undertaken by the Peacebuilding Fund as a catalytic, rapid-response and flexible pre-positioned pooled fund providing financing to activities to sustain peace in conflict-affected countries, and in advancing strategic alignment within the United Nations system and between the United Nations and the international financial institutions,
textWithHighlights: *Welcoming* the valuable work undertaken by the {{Peacebuilding Fund}} as a catalytic, rapid-response and flexible pre-positioned pooled fund providing financing to activities to sustain peace in conflict-affected countries, and in advancing strategic alignment within the {{United Nations system}} and between the United Nations and the {{international financial institutions}},

text: Recognizing the importance of strategic partnerships, pooled funding and blended finance between the United Nations, bilateral and international donors, multilateral financial institutions, and the private sector in order to share risks and maximize the impact of peacebuilding efforts, taking into account the need to ensure transparency, accountability and appropriate monitoring of funds,
textWithHighlights: *Recognizing* the importance of strategic partnerships, pooled funding and blended finance between the {{United Nations}}, bilateral and international donors, {{multilateral financial institutions}}, and the {{private sector}} in order to share risks and maximize the impact of peacebuilding efforts, *taking into account* the need to ensure transparency, accountability and appropriate monitoring of funds,
uncertainties: "taking into account" is not explicitly listed among the operative verbs; it is mapped here to the observing verb "bear in mind" as the closest equivalent. "bilateral and international donors" were not annotated as a specific entity because there is no exact category in the provided list.

text: Recognizing that the scale and nature of the challenge of sustaining peace calls for close strategic and operational partnerships between the United Nations, national governments and other key stakeholders, including international, regional and sub-regional organizations, international financial institutions, civil society organizations, women’s groups, youth organizations, and the private sector, taking into account national priorities and policies,
textWithHighlights: *Recognizing* that the scale and nature of the challenge of sustaining peace calls for close strategic and operational partnerships between the {{United Nations}}, {{national governments}} and other key stakeholders, including {{international}}, {{regional and sub-regional organizations}}, {{international financial institutions}}, {{civil society organizations}}, {{women’s groups}}, {{youth organizations}}, and the {{private sector}}, taking into account national priorities and policies,
uncertainties: Mapped 'national governments' to 'Member States'. Split 'international, regional and sub-regional organizations' into two mentions ('international organizations' and 'regional organizations'). Treated 'women’s groups' and 'youth organizations' as 'other' since they are not explicit categories in the entity list.

text: Welcoming the contribution of peacekeeping operations to a comprehensive strategy for sustaining peace and, noting with appreciation the contributions that peacekeepers and peacekeeping missions make to peacebuilding,
textWithHighlights: *Welcoming* the contribution of {{peacekeeping operations}} to a comprehensive strategy for sustaining peace and, *noting with appreciation* the contributions that {{peacekeepers}} and {{peacekeeping missions}} make to peacebuilding,
uncertainties: Classified 'peacekeeping operations', 'peacekeepers', and 'peacekeeping missions' as mentioned entities of type 'other' rather than specific UN Secretariat entities (e.g., DPO), since the text refers generically to operations and missions.

text: Reiterating that United Nations’ cooperation with regional and sub-regional organizations is critical to contributing to the prevention of the outbreak, escalation, continuation and recurrence of conflict, in line with Chapter VIII of the United Nations Charter,
textWithHighlights: *Reiterating* that {{United Nations}}’ cooperation with {{regional and sub-regional organizations}} is critical to contributing to the prevention of the outbreak, escalation, continuation and recurrence of conflict, in line with Chapter VIII of the United Nations Charter,
uncertainties: Normalized form for 'regional and sub-regional organizations' mapped to 'regional organizations' due to available categories.

text: Reaffirming the important role of women in peacebuilding and noting the substantial link between women’s full and meaningful involvement in efforts to prevent, resolve and rebuild from conflict and those efforts’ effectiveness and long term sustainability, and stressing, in this regard, the importance of women’s equal participation in all efforts for the maintenance and promotion of peace and security and the need to increase women’s role in decision-making with regard to conflict prevention and resolution and peacebuilding,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming* the important role of women in peacebuilding and *noting* the substantial link between women’s full and meaningful involvement in efforts to prevent, resolve and rebuild from conflict and those efforts’ effectiveness and long term sustainability, and *stressing*, in this regard, the importance of women’s equal participation in all efforts for the maintenance and promotion of peace and security and the need to increase women’s role in decision-making with regard to conflict prevention and resolution and peacebuilding,

text: Reaffirming the important role youth can play in the prevention and resolution of conflicts and as a key aspect of the sustainability, inclusiveness and success of peacekeeping and peacebuilding efforts,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming* the important role youth can play in the prevention and resolution of conflicts and as a key aspect of the sustainability, inclusiveness and success of peacekeeping and peacebuilding efforts,

text: Welcomes the valuable input of the Advisory Group of Experts on the Review of the Peacebuilding Architecture entitled the ‘Challenge of Sustaining Peace’;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity_normalized: Advisory Group of Experts on the Review of the Peacebuilding Architecture
mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Advisory Group of Experts on the Review of the Peacebuilding Architecture

textWithHighlights: *Welcomes* the valuable input of the {{Advisory Group of Experts on the Review of the Peacebuilding Architecture}} entitled the ‘Challenge of Sustaining Peace’;
uncertainties: Classified the Advisory Group of Experts as 'other' since it is not explicitly listed among UN Secretariat/System entities.

text: Emphasizes that sustaining peace requires coherence, sustained engagement, and coordination between the General Assembly, the Security Council, and the Economic and Social Council, consistent with their mandates as set out in the Charter of the United Nations;
textWithHighlights: *Emphasizes* that sustaining peace requires coherence, sustained engagement, and coordination between the {{General Assembly}}, the {{Security Council}}, and the {{Economic and Social Council}}, consistent with their mandates as set out in the Charter of the {{United Nations}};

text: Reaffirms the importance of national ownership and leadership in peacebuilding, whereby the responsibility for sustaining peace is broadly shared by the Government and all other national stakeholders and underlines the importance, in this regard, of inclusivity in order to ensure that the needs of all segments of society are taken into account;
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirms* the importance of national ownership and leadership in peacebuilding, whereby the responsibility for sustaining peace is broadly shared by the Government and all other national stakeholders and *underlines* the importance, in this regard, of inclusivity in order to ensure that the needs of all segments of society are taken into account;

text: Reaffirms its Resolution 1645 (2005), including the main purposes of the Peacebuilding Commission as an intergovernmental advisory body, and stresses the importance of the Peacebuilding Commission to fulfil the following functions in this regard:
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirms* its Resolution 1645 (2005), including the main purposes of the {{Peacebuilding Commission}} as an intergovernmental advisory body, and *stresses* the importance of the {{Peacebuilding Commission}} to fulfil the following functions in this regard:
uncertainties: Peacebuilding Commission is not listed in the provided entity list; treated as 'other' with normalized name 'Peacebuilding Commission (PBC)'.

text: To bring sustained international attention to sustaining peace, and to provide political accompaniment and advocacy to countries affected by conflict, with their consent;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Sustained international attention to sustaining peace
Political accompaniment and advocacy to conflict-affected countries

textWithHighlights: To bring [[sustained international attention]] to sustaining peace, and to provide [[political accompaniment and advocacy]] to countries affected by conflict, with their consent;
uncertainties: This subparagraph appears to inherit from a parent clause that stresses the importance of the Peacebuilding Commission fulfilling these functions. The implicit assignee is likely the Peacebuilding Commission, but it is not mentioned in this specific line, so no assignee is captured or highlighted here. No explicit operative verb is present in this line; one could arguably inherit “stress” from the parent, but it is reinforcing rather than directive.

text: To promote an integrated, strategic and coherent approach to peacebuilding, noting that security, development and human rights are closely interlinked and mutually reinforcing;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Integrated, strategic and coherent approach to peacebuilding
deliverables.deliverable: integrated, strategic and coherent approach to peacebuilding

textWithHighlights: To promote an [[integrated, strategic and coherent approach to peacebuilding]], noting that security, development and human rights are closely interlinked and mutually reinforcing;
uncertainties: This subparagraph inherits the operative context from the parent clause ('stresses the importance of the Peacebuilding Commission to fulfil the following functions'). The assignee (PBC) and verb are not present in this subparagraph text; only the deliverable is highlighted. The deliverable type could alternatively be classified as 'policy' rather than 'strategy'.

text: To serve a bridging role among the principal organs and relevant entities of the United Nations by sharing advice on peacebuilding needs and priorities, in line with the respective competencies and responsibilities of these bodies;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: advice on peacebuilding needs and priorities

textWithHighlights: To serve a bridging role among the principal organs and relevant entities of the {{United Nations}} by sharing [[advice]] on peacebuilding needs and priorities, in line with the respective competencies and responsibilities of these bodies;
uncertainties: Operative verb and assignee are inherited from the parent clause that stresses the importance of the Peacebuilding Commission to fulfil these functions; the assignee does not appear verbatim in this subparagraph.

text: To serve as a platform to convene all relevant actors within and outside the United Nations, including from Member States, national authorities, United Nations missions and country teams, international, regional and sub-regional organizations, international financial institutions, civil society, women’s groups, youth organizations and, where relevant, the private sector and national human rights institutions, in order to provide recommendations and information to improve their coordination, to develop and share good practices in peacebuilding, including on institution building, and to ensure predictable financing to peacebuilding;
textWithHighlights: To serve as a platform to [[convene]] all relevant actors within and outside the {{United Nations}}, including from {{Member States}}, national authorities, United Nations missions and {{country teams}}, {{international}}, {{regional and sub-regional organizations}}, {{international financial institutions}}, {{civil society}}, women’s groups, youth organizations and, where relevant, the {{private sector}} and national human rights institutions, in order to provide [[recommendations]] and [[information]] to improve their coordination, to develop and share [[good practices]] in peacebuilding, including on institution building, and to ensure [[predictable financing]] to peacebuilding;
uncertainties: This subparagraph inherits the operative context from the parent clause (“stresses the importance of the Peacebuilding Commission to fulfil the following functions”). Deliverables are treated as functions rather than directives; no explicit assignee is set. Mapped “good practices” to the ‘standards’ category; alternative could be ‘information_sharing’. Split “international, regional and sub-regional organizations” into normalized entities per schema; highlighted “international” and “regional and sub-regional organizations” to match text.

text: Encourages the Peacebuilding Commission, through its Organizational Committee, to review its provisional rules of procedure in order to improve the continuity of its Chairs and Vice-Chairs, enhance its focus on developments at the country and regional level, and foster greater engagement by its membership, and further encourages the Peacebuilding Commission, through its Organizational Committee, to consider diversifying its working methods to enhance its efficiency and flexibility in support of sustaining peace including by:

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Review of provisional rules of procedure

textWithHighlights: *Encourages* the <<Peacebuilding Commission>>, through its Organizational Committee, to [[review]] its provisional rules of procedure in order to improve the continuity of its Chairs and Vice-Chairs, enhance its focus on developments at the country and regional level, and foster greater engagement by its membership, and *further encourages* the <<Peacebuilding Commission>>, through its Organizational Committee, to consider [[diversifying its working methods]] to enhance its efficiency and flexibility in support of sustaining peace including by:
uncertainties: The Peacebuilding Commission (PBC) is not listed explicitly in the provided entity list of UN Organs; I classified it as a UN Organ with normalized name 'Peacebuilding Commission'. If required to stick strictly to the list, it could alternatively be mapped to 'Other (Other United Nations Bodies)'. The deliverable 'consider diversifying its working methods' is somewhat less concrete; I categorized it under 'policy' as an institutional working-methods change.

text: Providing options for its country-specific meetings and formats, to be applied upon the request of the country concerned, as referred to the Commission in accordance with the relevant provisions of its resolution 1645;

assignees.assignee: Peacebuilding Commission, through its Organizational Committee

deliverables.deliverable: options for its country-specific meetings and formats

textWithHighlights: Providing [[options for its country-specific meetings and formats]], to be applied upon the request of the country concerned, as referred to the {{Commission}} in accordance with the relevant provisions of its resolution 1645;
uncertainties: Assignee is inherited from the parent clause that encourages the Peacebuilding Commission (through its Organizational Committee); it is not explicitly present in this subparagraph. Deliverable type could also be classified as 'standards' rather than 'policy' since it concerns meeting formats/options. The entity type for the Peacebuilding Commission is set to 'other' because it is not listed explicitly among UN Organs in the provided list.

text: Enabling it to consider regional and cross-cutting issues relevant to sustaining peace;

assignees.assignee: the Peacebuilding Commission, through its Organizational Committee

textWithHighlights: Enabling it to consider regional and cross-cutting issues relevant to sustaining peace;
uncertainties: Operative verb and assignee are inherited from the parent clause that 'encourages' the Peacebuilding Commission, through its Organizational Committee, to diversify working methods. No concrete deliverable is specified in this subparagraph.

text: Enhancing synergies between the Peacebuilding Fund and the Peacebuilding Commission, and;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Enhanced synergies between PBF and PBC

textWithHighlights: Enhancing [[synergies]] between the {{Peacebuilding Fund}} and the <<Peacebuilding Commission>>, and;
uncertainties: Operative verb and assignee are inherited from the parent clause that 'encourages' the Peacebuilding Commission to consider diversifying its working methods. Deliverable categorized as 'strategy' as a proxy for coordination/synergy enhancement.

text: Continuing to use its annual session to facilitate closer engagement with relevant stakeholders;

assignees.assignee: Peacebuilding Commission, through its Organizational Committee

textWithHighlights: Continuing to use its [[annual session]] to facilitate closer engagement with relevant stakeholders;

text: Reaffirms its call upon the Peacebuilding Commission to integrate a gender perspective into all of its work;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Integrate gender perspective into all work

textWithHighlights: *Reaffirms* its call upon the <<Peacebuilding Commission>> to [[integrate a gender perspective]] into all of its work;

text: Requests the Peacebuilding Commission to include in its annual report information on progress in implementing the provisions of its present resolution relating to its working methods and provisional rules of procedure;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Progress update on implementation of working methods and provisional rules

textWithHighlights: *Requests* the <<Peacebuilding Commission>> to include in its annual report [[information on progress]] in implementing the provisions of its present resolution relating to its working methods and provisional rules of procedure;
uncertainties: Classified the deliverable as an 'update' (progress information) rather than 'report' since the task is to include progress information within the annual report, not to produce the report itself.

text: Acknowledges the importance of strong coordination, coherence and cooperation with the Peacebuilding Commission, in accordance with its resolution 1645, and in this regard, expresses its intention to regularly request, deliberate and draw upon the specific, strategic and targeted advice of the Peacebuilding Commission, including to assist with the longer-term perspective required for sustaining peace being reflected in the formation, review and drawdown of peacekeeping operations and special political missions mandates;
textWithHighlights: *Acknowledges* the importance of strong coordination, coherence and cooperation with the {{Peacebuilding Commission}}, in accordance with its resolution 1645, and in this regard, *expresses* its intention to regularly request, deliberate and draw upon the specific, strategic and targeted advice of the {{Peacebuilding Commission}}, including to assist with the longer-term perspective required for sustaining peace being reflected in the formation, review and drawdown of peacekeeping operations and special political missions mandates;
uncertainties: Treated “expresses” as an evaluative operative verb (“express”) noting an intention, not a directive. No concrete deliverables identified.

text: Emphasizes the importance of drawing upon the advice of the Peacebuilding Commission when major agreements that relate to United Nations mission mandates and transitions, are agreed between the United Nations, national governments and authorities, and other relevant stakeholders;
textWithHighlights: *Emphasizes* the importance of drawing upon the advice of the {{Peacebuilding Commission}} when major agreements that relate to {{United Nations}} mission mandates and transitions, are agreed between the {{United Nations}}, {{national governments and authorities}}, and other relevant stakeholders;
uncertainties: Classified Peacebuilding Commission as a UN Organ (not explicitly listed). Mapped 'national governments and authorities' to 'Member States'.

text: Stresses the importance of closer cooperation between the Economic and Social Council and Peacebuilding Commission, in accordance with their respective mandates, including through enhanced dialogue in support of promoting coherence and complementarity between the United Nations’ peace and security efforts and its development, human rights and humanitarian work, and encourages the Peacebuilding Commission to draw on the expertise of relevant Economic and Social Council subsidiary bodies, as appropriate;
textWithHighlights: *Stresses* the importance of closer cooperation between the {{Economic and Social Council}} and Peacebuilding Commission, in accordance with their respective mandates, including through enhanced dialogue in support of promoting coherence and complementarity between the {{United Nations’}} peace and security efforts and its development, human rights and humanitarian work, and *encourages* the <<Peacebuilding Commission>> to draw on the expertise of relevant {{Economic and Social Council}} subsidiary bodies, as appropriate;
uncertainties: The Peacebuilding Commission is not listed among predefined entities; it is treated as an assignee of type "other" with normalized name "Peacebuilding Commission". The phrase "to draw on the expertise" is an action but not annotated as a concrete deliverable since it does not clearly fit a deliverable category.

text: Encourages United Nations Member States participating in the Universal Periodic Review process of the Human Rights Council to consider the human rights dimensions of peacebuilding, as appropriate;
textWithHighlights: *Encourages* <<United Nations Member States>> participating in the Universal Periodic Review process of the {{Human Rights Council}} to consider the human rights dimensions of peacebuilding, as appropriate;

text: Stresses that a comprehensive approach to transitional justice, including promotion of healing and reconciliation, a professional, accountable and effective security sector, including through its reform, and inclusive and effective demobilization, disarmament and reintegration programmes, including the transition from demobilization and disarmament to reintegration, are critical to consolidation of peace and stability, promoting poverty reduction, rule of law, access to justice and good governance, further extending legitimate state authority, and preventing countries from lapsing or relapsing into conflict;
textWithHighlights: *Stresses* that a comprehensive approach to transitional justice, including promotion of healing and reconciliation, a professional, accountable and effective security sector, including through its reform, and inclusive and effective demobilization, disarmament and reintegration programmes, including the transition from demobilization and disarmament to reintegration, are critical to consolidation of peace and stability, promoting poverty reduction, rule of law, access to justice and good governance, further extending legitimate state authority, and preventing countries from lapsing or relapsing into conflict;

text: Recognizes that effective peacebuilding must involve the entire United Nations system, and in this regard, emphasizes the importance of joint analysis and effective strategic planning across the United Nations system in its long term engagement in conflict-affected countries and, where appropriate, in cooperation and coordination with regional and sub-regional organizations;
textWithHighlights: *Recognizes* that effective peacebuilding must involve the entire {{United Nations system}}, and in this regard, *emphasizes* the importance of joint analysis and effective strategic planning across the {{United Nations system}} in its long term engagement in conflict-affected countries and, where appropriate, in cooperation and coordination with {{regional}} and {{sub-regional organizations}};

text: Emphasizes the important role that effective and responsive leadership in United Nations country operations can play in bringing together the United Nations system around a common strategy for sustaining peace, and in this regard, stresses the need for more coordinated, coherent and integrated peacebuilding efforts, including among United Nations missions, United Nations country teams, and national, regional and international development actors, in ensuring greater effectiveness and efficiency in the delivery of critical peacebuilding tasks;
textWithHighlights: *Emphasizes* the important role that effective and responsive leadership in United Nations country operations can play in bringing together the {{United Nations system}} around a common strategy for sustaining peace, and in this regard, *stresses* the need for more coordinated, coherent and integrated peacebuilding efforts, including among {{United Nations missions}}, {{United Nations country teams}}, and national, regional and international development actors, in ensuring greater effectiveness and efficiency in the delivery of critical peacebuilding tasks;
uncertainties: Mapped "United Nations missions" to the generic "UN" (UN Secretariat) as no generic entity for missions exists in the provided list.

text: Stresses that the Peacebuilding Support Office should be revitalized, and emphasizes that the full support of the Secretary-General is needed, in order for the Peacebuilding Support Office to support the Peacebuilding Commission, to increase synergies with other parts of the United Nations system, and to provide strategic advice to the Secretary-General, drawing together the expertise of the United Nations system to facilitate coherent system-wide action and support partnerships for sustaining peace;
textWithHighlights: *Stresses* that the {{Peacebuilding Support Office}} should be revitalized, and *emphasizes* that the full support of the {{Secretary-General}} is needed, in order for the {{Peacebuilding Support Office}} to support the {{Peacebuilding Commission}}, to increase synergies with other parts of the {{United Nations system}}, and to provide strategic advice to the {{Secretary-General}}, drawing together the expertise of the {{United Nations system}} to facilitate coherent system-wide action and support partnerships for sustaining peace;
uncertainties: Peacebuilding Commission (PBC) and Peacebuilding Support Office (PBSO) are not explicitly listed in the provided entity list; PBSO is treated as a UN Secretariat entity (normalized as PBSO) and PBC is classified under 'other' with its full name. No concrete deliverables are extracted since the paragraph uses reinforcing verbs rather than directive/deciding language.

text: Recognizes that development is a central goal in itself and recognizes the important contributions of the United Nations development system to peacebuilding, particularly through economic development and poverty eradication, and stresses the need to continue strengthening cooperation and coordination for that purpose in the field through United Nations Country Teams and at United Nations Headquarters, in accordance with their respective mandates, and with respect for national ownership and priorities of countries-affected by conflict, including through the overarching framework of the United Nations operational activities for development;
textWithHighlights: *Recognizes* that development is a central goal in itself and *recognizes* the important contributions of the {{United Nations development system}} to peacebuilding, particularly through economic development and poverty eradication, and *stresses* the need to continue strengthening cooperation and coordination for that purpose in the field through {{United Nations Country Teams}} and at United Nations Headquarters, in accordance with their respective mandates, and with respect for national ownership and priorities of countries-affected by conflict, including through the overarching framework of the United Nations operational activities for development;
uncertainties: Considered but did not map “United Nations Headquarters” to an entity (e.g., UN Secretariat), treating it as a location reference rather than an organization. Also treated “continue strengthening cooperation and coordination” as non-concrete, hence not a deliverable.

text: Takes note of the Secretary-General’s decision to request the United Nations Development Group to take forward a review of the current capacities of agencies, funds and programmes and particularly looks forward to its findings contributing to enhancing the United Nations capacities relating to sustaining peace;
textWithHighlights: *Takes note* of the {{Secretary-General}}’s decision to request the {{United Nations Development Group}} to take forward a review of the current capacities of {{agencies}}, {{funds}} and {{programmes}} and particularly *looks forward* to its findings contributing to enhancing the {{United Nations}} capacities relating to sustaining peace;
uncertainties: Mapped 'United Nations Development Group' to 'UN Development System' as it is not explicitly listed; if a distinct entity is preferred, adjust normalization.

text: Underlines that the scale and nature of the challenge of sustaining peace can be met through close strategic and operational partnerships between national governments, the United Nations, and other key stakeholders, including international, regional and sub-regional organizations, international financial institutions, regional and other development banks, civil society organizations, women’s groups, youth organizations and where relevant, the private sector, and encourages the Peacebuilding Commission to consider options for regular exchanges and joint initiatives with key stakeholders to promote sustainable peace, including in the framework of the annual sessions of the Peacebuilding Commission;
textWithHighlights: *Underlines* that the scale and nature of the challenge of sustaining peace can be met through close strategic and operational partnerships between {{national governments}}, the {{United Nations}}, and other key stakeholders, including {{international}}, {{regional and sub-regional organizations}}, {{international financial institutions}}, {{regional and other development banks}}, {{civil society organizations}}, {{women’s groups}}, {{youth organizations}} and where relevant, the {{private sector}}, and *encourages* the <<Peacebuilding Commission>> to consider options for regular exchanges and joint initiatives with key stakeholders to promote sustainable peace, including in the framework of the annual sessions of the Peacebuilding Commission;

text: Stresses the importance of partnership and cooperation between the United Nations and relevant regional and sub-regional organizations, including the African Union, to improve cooperation and coordination in peacebuilding, to increase synergies and ensure the coherence and complementarity of such efforts, and in this regard, urges the Peacebuilding Commission to hold regular exchanges of views with relevant regional and sub-regional organizations and encourages regular exchanges, joint initiatives, and information sharing between the Peacebuilding Support Office and relevant bodies of regional and sub-regional organizations, such as the African Union Commission;
textWithHighlights: *Stresses* the importance of partnership and cooperation between the {{United Nations}} and {{relevant regional and sub-regional organizations}}, including the {{African Union}}, to improve cooperation and coordination in peacebuilding, to increase synergies and ensure the coherence and complementarity of such efforts, and in this regard, *urges* the <<Peacebuilding Commission>> to hold [[regular exchanges of views]] with {{relevant regional and sub-regional organizations}} and *encourages* [[regular exchanges]], [[joint initiatives]], and [[information sharing]] between the <<Peacebuilding Support Office>> and relevant bodies of {{regional and sub-regional organizations}}, such as the {{African Union Commission}};
uncertainties: "Joint initiatives" is somewhat vague; categorized as a strategy-type deliverable but could be considered too general. The entity mapping for the Peacebuilding Commission is treated as a UN organ though not explicitly listed in the provided entity list.

text: Requests the Secretary-General to explore options for strengthening the United Nations-World Bank collaboration in conflict-affected countries in order to:

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: analysis of options to strengthen UN-World Bank collaboration

textWithHighlights: *Requests* the <<Secretary-General>> to [[explore options]] for strengthening the {{United Nations}}-{{World Bank}} collaboration in conflict-affected countries in order to:
uncertainties: Deliverable categorized as analysis; could also be interpreted as strategy/policy development.

text: assist such countries, upon their request, in creating an enabling environment for economic growth, foreign investment and job creation, and in the mobilization and effective use of domestic resources, in line with national priorities and underscored by the principle of national ownership;

deliverables.deliverable: mobilization and effective use of domestic resources

textWithHighlights: [[assist]] such countries, upon their request, in [[creating an enabling environment]] for economic growth, foreign investment and job creation, and in the [[mobilization and effective use of domestic resources]], in line with national priorities and underscored by the principle of national ownership;
uncertainties: This subparagraph inherits the operative verb and assignee from the parent clause (“Requests the Secretary-General … in order to:”). The Secretary-General is not explicitly mentioned in this subparagraph, so no assignee is highlighted here. The deliverables represent the intended purposes of the collaboration; while they are goals of the assistance rather than standalone tasks, they are treated as deliverables linked to the inherited request.

text: marshal resources, and align their regional and country strategies, to promote sustainable peace;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: alignment of regional and country strategies
deliverables.deliverable: align their regional and country strategies

textWithHighlights: [[marshal resources]], and [[align their regional and country strategies]], to promote sustainable peace;
uncertainties: This subparagraph inherits the directive verb and assignee from the parent clause (“Requests the Secretary-General to explore options … in order to:”). The listed items are purposes/outcomes of strengthened UN–World Bank collaboration rather than direct tasks for the Secretary-General, but are treated here as deliverables under the inherited request.

text: support the creation of enlarged funding platforms bringing together the World Bank Group, multilateral and bilateral donors and regional actors to pool resources, share and mitigate risk, and maximize impact for sustaining peace;
textWithHighlights: support the creation of [[enlarged funding platforms]] bringing together the {{World Bank Group}}, multilateral and bilateral donors and regional actors to pool resources, share and mitigate risk, and maximize impact for sustaining peace;
uncertainties: This subparagraph inherits the operative verb and assignee from the parent clause (“Requests the Secretary-General to…”). The deliverable is interpreted as the establishment of funding platforms, categorized under financial resources; purposes like pooling resources and mitigating risk are not separately extracted.

text: enable and encourage regular exchanges on priority peacebuilding areas;
textWithHighlights: enable and encourage [[regular exchanges]] on priority peacebuilding areas;
uncertainties: Classified "regular exchanges" as a meeting; could also be seen as information_sharing.

text: Underscores the importance of women’s leadership and participation in conflict prevention, resolution and peacebuilding, and recognizes the continuing need to increase representation of women at all decision-making levels in national, regional and international institutions and mechanisms for the prevention and resolution of conflict, and the consideration of gender-related issues in all discussions pertinent to sustaining peace;
textWithHighlights: *Underscores* the importance of women’s leadership and participation in conflict prevention, resolution and peacebuilding, and *recognizes* the continuing need to increase representation of women at all decision-making levels in national, regional and international institutions and mechanisms for the prevention and resolution of conflict, and the consideration of gender-related issues in all discussions pertinent to sustaining peace;
uncertainties: The paragraph notes the need to increase women’s representation and consider gender-related issues, but these are not phrased as directives to specific assignees, so no deliverables or assignees are extracted.

text: Encourages the Secretary-General to promote the gender dimensions of peacebuilding, including through the delivery of gender-sensitive and targeted programming, through the strengthening of women’s meaningful participation in peacebuilding, supporting women’s organizations and through monitoring, tracking and reporting achievement;
textWithHighlights: *Encourages* the <<Secretary-General>> to promote the gender dimensions of peacebuilding, including through the delivery of gender-sensitive and targeted programming, through the strengthening of women’s meaningful participation in peacebuilding, supporting {{women’s organizations}} and through [[monitoring]], tracking and [[reporting]] achievement;
uncertainties: Unclear whether “delivery of gender-sensitive and targeted programming” should be extracted as a deliverable and which category would best fit (policy, capacity building, or technical assistance). Also somewhat uncertain whether to include “women’s organizations” as a mentioned entity (general civil society grouping rather than a specific entity).

text: Calls upon Member States and relevant United Nations organs and entities to consider ways to increase meaningful and inclusive participation of youth in peacebuilding efforts through creating policies, including in partnership with private sector where relevant, that would enhance youth capacities and skills, and create youth employment to actively contribute to sustaining peace, and in this regard, requests the Secretary-General and the Peacebuilding Commission to include in their recommendations ways to engage youth in peacebuilding;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: policies to increase youth participation in peacebuilding
recommendations on youth engagement in peacebuilding

textWithHighlights: *Calls upon* <<Member States>> and relevant <<United Nations organs and entities>> to consider ways to increase meaningful and inclusive participation of youth in peacebuilding efforts through creating [[policies]], including in partnership with {{private sector}} where relevant, that would enhance youth capacities and skills, and create youth employment to actively contribute to sustaining peace, and in this regard, *requests* the <<Secretary-General>> and the <<Peacebuilding Commission>> to include in their [[recommendations]] ways to engage youth in peacebuilding;
uncertainties: "United Nations organs and entities" is broad; normalized as "UN System" for practicality, though it may also encompass UN organs. Peacebuilding Commission (PBC) is not explicitly listed in the provided entities; treated as a UN organ with normalized abbreviation "PBC". The deliverable "policies" is inferred as the concrete action, while enhancements to capacities/skills and youth employment are treated as intended effects rather than separate deliverables.

text: Emphasizes the need for predictable and sustained financing to United Nations peacebuilding activities, including through increased contributions, and strengthened partnerships with key stakeholders, while also noting the significance that non-monetary contributions can play in peacebuilding efforts;
textWithHighlights: *Emphasizes* the need for predictable and sustained financing to {{United Nations}} peacebuilding activities, including through increased contributions, and strengthened partnerships with key stakeholders, while also noting the significance that non-monetary contributions can play in peacebuilding efforts;

text: Welcomes the contributions made to the Peacebuilding Fund, takes note of the proposals in the Advisory Group of Experts’ report in this regard and urges all Member States, including non-traditional donors and other partners, to consider making voluntary contributions to the fund, including by building on the practice of making multi-year commitments to the fund;
textWithHighlights: *Welcomes* the contributions made to the {{Peacebuilding Fund}}, *takes note* of the proposals in the {{Advisory Group of Experts}}’ report in this regard and *urges* <<all Member States>>, including non-traditional donors and other partners, to consider making [[voluntary contributions]] to the fund, including by building on the practice of making [[multi-year commitments]] to the fund;
uncertainties: "Non-traditional donors and other partners" are not clearly defined entities; only "all Member States" is captured as the assignee. The Peacebuilding Fund is captured as an 'other' entity since it is not explicitly listed in the provided entity catalogue.

text: Recognizes the importance of adequately resourcing the peacebuilding components of relevant United Nations peacekeeping operations and special political missions, including during mission transitions and drawdown, to support stability and continuity of peacebuilding activities;
textWithHighlights: *Recognizes* the importance of adequately resourcing the peacebuilding components of relevant {{United Nations}} peacekeeping operations and special political missions, including during mission transitions and drawdown, to support stability and continuity of peacebuilding activities;
uncertainties: Considered tagging 'United Nations peacekeeping operations' and 'special political missions' as mentioned entities, but there is no clear match in the entity list; only 'United Nations' is tagged generically.

text: Stresses the importance of enhancing the mobilization of resources for initiatives that address the particular needs of women in peacebuilding contexts, advance gender equality, and empower women;
textWithHighlights: *Stresses* the importance of enhancing the mobilization of resources for initiatives that address the particular needs of women in peacebuilding contexts, advance gender equality, and empower women;

text: Takes note of the General Assembly decision to include in the agenda of its seventy-first session an item entitled ‘Peacebuilding and Sustaining Peace’;
textWithHighlights: *Takes note* of the {{General Assembly}} decision to include in the agenda of its seventy-first session an item entitled ‘Peacebuilding and Sustaining Peace’;

text: Takes note of the General Assembly decision to convene at its seventy-second session, under the agenda item ‘Peacebuilding and Sustaining Peace’, a high-level meeting of the General Assembly on efforts undertaken and opportunities to strengthen the United Nations’ work on sustaining peace, on a date and in a format to be decided by the President of the General Assembly;
textWithHighlights: *Takes note* of the {{General Assembly}} decision to convene at its seventy-second session, under the agenda item ‘Peacebuilding and Sustaining Peace’, a high-level meeting of the {{General Assembly}} on efforts undertaken and opportunities to strengthen the {{United Nations}}’ work on sustaining peace, on a date and in a format to be decided by the {{President of the General Assembly}};

text: Takes note of the General Assembly decision to invite the Secretary-General to report to the seventy-second session of the General Assembly, at least sixty days prior to the high-level meeting on ‘Peacebuilding and Sustaining Peace’, on efforts to implement its present resolution, including in the following areas:
textWithHighlights: *Takes note* of the {{General Assembly}} decision to invite the {{Secretary-General}} to report to the seventy-second session of the {{General Assembly}}, at least sixty days prior to the high-level meeting on ‘Peacebuilding and Sustaining Peace’, on efforts to implement its present resolution, including in the following areas:

text: To strengthen operational and policy coherence within the United Nations system towards sustaining peace, including strengthened strategic planning across the United Nations system;
textWithHighlights: To strengthen operational and policy coherence within the {{United Nations system}} towards sustaining peace, including strengthened strategic planning across the {{United Nations system}};
uncertainties: This appears to be a sub-item under the parent clause that 'stresses the importance of the Peacebuilding Commission to fulfil the following functions'; thus the inherited operative verb is 'stresses' and there is no explicit assignee or concrete deliverable in this subparagraph.

text: To improve internal United Nations leadership, capability, and accountability — at Headquarters, and in the field — on efforts to sustain peace;
textWithHighlights: To improve internal {{United Nations}} leadership, capability, and accountability — at Headquarters, and in the field — on efforts to sustain peace;
uncertainties: This subparagraph appears to inherit the operative verb and assignee from the parent clause: “Requests the Secretary-General to explore options … in order to:”. The item itself states a purpose rather than a concrete deliverable, so no deliverable is extracted.

text: To ensure continuity of relevant peacebuilding programmes, senior leadership, and personnel, as appropriate, through the different phases of United Nations engagement, in order to improve mission transitions;
textWithHighlights: To ensure continuity of relevant peacebuilding programmes, senior leadership, and personnel, as appropriate, through the different phases of {{United Nations}} engagement, in order to improve mission transitions;
uncertainties: This subparagraph likely inherits its operative verb from a parent clause. It most plausibly falls under 'Takes note of the GA decision ... including in the following areas:', hence 'take note'. It could alternatively be read as part of 'Requests the Secretary-General ... in order to:'. No concrete deliverable is explicitly tasked here.

text: To strengthen partnerships between the United Nations and key stakeholders, including international, regional and sub-regional organizations, international financial institutions, and civil society organizations;
textWithHighlights: To strengthen partnerships between the {{United Nations}} and key stakeholders, including international, {{regional and sub-regional organizations}}, {{international financial institutions}}, and {{civil society organizations}};
uncertainties: This subparagraph likely inherits the operative verb from the earlier clause 'Takes note of the General Assembly decision to invite the Secretary-General to report ... including in the following areas:'. It could alternatively belong under 'Requests the Secretary-General to explore options ... in order to:', but the phrasing aligns with the earlier 'including in the following areas' list.

text: To provide options on increasing, restructuring and better prioritizing funding dedicated to United Nations peacebuilding activities, including through assessed and voluntary contributions, with a view to ensuring sustainable financing for the consideration of Member States;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Options to increase, restructure and prioritize financing for UN peacebuilding activities

textWithHighlights: To [[provide options]] on increasing, restructuring and better prioritizing funding dedicated to {{United Nations}} peacebuilding activities, including through assessed and voluntary contributions, with a view to ensuring sustainable financing for the consideration of {{Member States}};
uncertainties: This subparagraph inherits the operative verb (Requests) and the assignee (UN Secretary-General) from the parent clause, which are not explicitly present in the text here.

text: To provide options for adequate resourcing of the peacebuilding activities of United Nations Country Teams, and the peacebuilding components of United Nations peacekeeping operations and special political missions, including during mission transitions and drawdown for the consideration of Member States;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Options for adequate resourcing of peacebuilding activities

textWithHighlights: To [[provide options]] for adequate resourcing of the peacebuilding activities of {{United Nations Country Teams}}, and the peacebuilding components of {{United Nations peacekeeping operations}} and {{special political missions}}, including during mission transitions and drawdown for the consideration of {{Member States}};

text: To strengthen the capacity of the senior leadership of the United Nations Country Team to absorb relevant peacebuilding functions following the drawdown of Security Council mandated missions;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Strengthen UNCT senior leadership capacity for post-mission peacebuilding functions

textWithHighlights: To [[strengthen the capacity]] of the senior leadership of the {{United Nations Country Team}} to absorb relevant peacebuilding functions following the drawdown of {{Security Council}} mandated missions;
uncertainties: This appears to be a subparagraph inheriting the directive "Requests the Secretary-General..." from a parent clause not shown here; the assignee and operative verb are inferred.

text: To support the participation of women and youth in peacebuilding processes, including through advocacy with national stakeholders, and support to women’s and youth organizations;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Support participation of women and youth in peacebuilding
Support to women's and youth organizations
deliverables.deliverable: support to women’s and youth organizations

textWithHighlights: To [[support the participation]] of women and youth in peacebuilding processes, including through [[advocacy]] with national stakeholders, and [[support to women’s and youth organizations]];
uncertainties: This subparagraph inherits the operative verb and assignee from the parent clause ('Requests the Secretary-General to explore options... in order to:'). Deliverable categorization (capacity_building vs technical_assistance/financial_resources) is inferred; text is broad.

text: To revitalize the Peacebuilding Support Office;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Revitalization of the Peacebuilding Support Office

textWithHighlights: To [[revitalize]] the {{Peacebuilding Support Office}};
uncertainties: Assumed this is a subparagraph inheriting the verb and assignee from the earlier clause 'Requests the Secretary-General to ... in order to:'. If instead it inherits from a different parent (e.g., a 'Takes note ... including in the following areas:' clause), the action_verb_normalized would be 'take note' and no assignee would apply.

text: Calls for a further comprehensive review of United Nations peacebuilding at its seventy-fourth session;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Comprehensive review of United Nations peacebuilding

textWithHighlights: *Calls for* a further [[comprehensive review]] of {{United Nations}} peacebuilding at its seventy-fourth session;
uncertainties: "its seventy-fourth session" likely refers to the General Assembly’s 74th session, but GA is not explicitly mentioned; thus no assignee is recorded.

text: Decides to remain seized of the matter.
textWithHighlights: *Decides* to remain seized of the matter.
